{{title|Compile-time rational arithmetic {{mark since c++11}}}}
{{cpp/numeric/ratio/navbar}}

The class template {{tt|std::ratio}} and associated templates provide compile-time rational arithmetic support. Each instantiation of this template exactly represents any finite rational number.

===Compile-time fractions===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc header|ratio}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio}}
{{dsc end}}
{{cpp/numeric/ratio/typedefs table}}

===Compile-time rational arithmetic===
Several alias templates, that perform arithmetic operations on {{tt|ratio}} objects at compile-time are provided.

{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc header|ratio}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_add}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_subtract}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_multiply}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_divide}}
{{dsc end}}

===Compile-time rational comparison===
Several class templates, that perform comparison operations on {{tt|ratio}} objects at compile-time are provided.

{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc header|ratio}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_equal}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_not_equal}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_less}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_less_equal}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_greater}}
{{dsc inc|cpp/numeric/ratio/dsc ratio_greater_equal}}
{{dsc end}}
